comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3420) (MYAIR-3835)
# 1. When the patient goes to the coaching section for the first time on a given phone then Monte Carlo shall ask the patient for permission to enable push notifications
# Note 1: Use myAir Support website with Admin Credentials to check the Notification Status. ( https://mcsupport.hawkesbury.int/Default.aspx  )
# Note 2: It is assumed that the Android default of having App notifications enabled has not been changed by the user

# Note 3: When testing manually, after the test steps, sign into the support website from Note 1, and check that the push token is there if the scenario has enabled push notifications. If the scenario has not enabled push notifications, the push token should not be there.
# Note 4: If the patient chooses to enable push notifications then both Coaching and Cleaning Reminder push notifications are to be enabled.

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: After installing the app, go to the "Coaching" screen, enable push notifications and verify the system dialog to request permission displays

steps.name: notifications are enabled in System settings
I open the app on the "Coaching" screen
I should see the "Push notifications permission" dialog
I tap the "Allow" button
I should see the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I dismiss the "Push notifications are now enabled" dialog
I navigate to the "My notifications" screen
I wait for network sync
I see the "Push notifications Coaching" is turned on
I see the "Push notifications Cleaning Reminder" is turned on

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2622) (MYAIR-3444)
# 1. If the user selects a navigation tab that has a badge icon, then Monte Carlo shall execute the push notification associated with the tab badge icon.
# Note: Score tip push notification does no action. Coaching tip or Sleep library push notification updates the appropriate section and auto-navigates user to appropriate media asset.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MCA-2623) (MYAIR-3374)
# 1. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a coaching tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 2. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a sleep library push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the coaching tab
# 3. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the coaching tab and the coaching tab is pressed, then the badge shall be removed
# 4. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when a score tip push notification has been received then a badge icon shall be shown on the dashboard tab
# 5. Given Monte Carlo is in the foreground, when there is a badge on the dashboard tab and the dashboard tab is pressed or on App launch, then the badge shall be removed
# 6. Given Monte Carlo has tab badge icons when App is closed (user or OS closed), then the previous tab badge icons shall be shown when App is re-launched.
# Note: When Monte Carlo is in foreground and a push notification is received, the push will NOT show up in system tray; it will only result in the push's associated navigation tab being badged.
# Note: For android use this command to get the Token = adb logcat -v time | grep Refreshed
# Note: For android use this command to get the AccountIdentifier = adb logcat -v time | egrep AccountIdentifier
#ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA (MYAIR-3528) (MCA-2521)
# 1. When App receives a push notification, regardless if App is in foreground or background, then a badge shall be shown on the App launch icon.
# 2. The badge on the App launch icon shall persist as long as there are outstanding push notifications to be actioned by user.

# Note: When App is in the background and a push notification is received the push notification details are displayed in the system tray.  When a user opens the App, regardless if opened by App Icon or system tray push notification, the App Icon badge is removed and all system tray push notifications are cleared (i.e. no longer outstanding)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account
Push notifications are enabled
notifications are enabled in System settings
existing badge icon on "Dashboard" tab has been removed
existing badge icon on "Coaching" tab has been removed

elements.name: Verify the tab badge icon appears after closing the app and re-launching it.

steps.name: I open the app on the "Profile" screen
a "SleepLibrary" push notification is received
I should see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab
I close the app
I open the app
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen
I should see a badge icon on the "Coaching" tab

name: Show badge icon when new data is received from patient portal or from coaching tip push notification

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-89)(MYAIR-2974)

# 1. If the user has been registered for 30 nights or longer, the user shall be able to see the 95th percentile Leak for each of the most recent 30 nights inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".

# 2. If the user has been registered for less than 30 nights, the user shall be able to see the 95th percentile Leak for each of the nights the user has been registered inclusive from the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night".
# 3. Monte Carlo shall show how the Leak score is calculated
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: User should be able to see number of mask leaks for less than 30 nights.

steps.name: I have "5" days of sleep data
I open the app on the "History" screen
I tap the "Seal history" button
I should see the "Mask Seal History" values for 5 days

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-3537) (MYAIR-3930)
#  1.  Given the patient is signed-in and already has a device registered with their account, then the App shall allow the patient to change the device registered with their account
#  Note: See MCA-3536 for device registration requirements
# For testing Use these Values:
#    Existing Account : test.resmed11+139@gmail.com / Resmed123  (Default Device = 69362761035 )
#    Updated Device Serial : 56855204271
# V5 Patient Portal Endpoints : https://confluence.ec2.local/display/MON/V5+Patient+Portal+Endpoints
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3002)(MCA-2536)
# 1. If the user has an AirSense in their account, then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine that is provided by Patient Portal
# 2. In the event Patient Portal returns last sync time as "1900-01-01T00:00:00.000Z" then Monte Carlo shall display the last sync time for that machine as "-"
# Note 1: By default the App displays "-" for last sync time (i.e. sync has yet to occur).
# Note 2: Example format for displaying last sync time is Jan 12, 1952 3:30 PM
# Note 3: Date and time is based on the phone's local date and time
# Note:  All the test scenarios in this feature file require usage of the Patient Portal server
# Mock uses the following serial numbers / devices numbers / make / models for responses
# | Serial Number | Device Number | Made By            | Model                          | Notes                 |
# | 78899898308   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 Autoset            | * Default in mock     |
# | 56221828959   | 564           | ResMed             | AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her    |                       |

steps.name: I enable Wifi
I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Patient changes Device serial and device numbers successfully

steps.name: I open the app on the "My equipment" screen
I tap the "Update machine" button
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I enter "56221828959" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "564" into the "Device number" field
I tap the "Save" button
I wait for data sync
the serial number "56221828959" and device number "564" are sent to the Patient Portal
I should be on the "My equipment" screen
I should see the value "ResMed" in the "Made by" field
I should see the value "AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her" in the "Model" field
I should see the value "56221828959" in the "Serial number" field
I navigate to the "Profile" screen
I press "Sign out icon" button
I press "Sign out" button confirmation
I sign in with this account on another mobile device
I navigate to the "My equipment" screen
I should see the value "ResMed" in the "Made by" field
I should see the value "AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her" in the "Model" field
I should see the value "56221828959" in the "Serial number" field

elements.name: Verify that the user can add a valid FG after being redirected to the "Update machine" screen followed by successfully adding a valid FG which has synced to patient Portal to the account

steps.name: FG ID is not assigned to the account
I open the app on the "Dashboard" screen
I should be on the "Update machine" screen
I should see the "Serial number" field
I should see the "Device number" field
I enter "56221828959" into the "Serial number" field
I enter "564" into the "Device number" field
I tap the "Save" button
I should be on the "Add mask" screen
the serial number "56221828959" and device number "564" should have been sent to Patient Portal
I select "Nasal" for Mask Type
I select "ResMed" for Mask Brand
I select "Swift FX Nano" for Mask Model
I tap the "Save" button
I should be on the "Dashboard" screen
I navigate to the "More" screen
the FG has sent sleep data to Patient Portal
it has been "301" seconds since data sync
I navigate to the "Dashboard" screen
I wait for data sync
I navigate to the "My equipment" screen
I should see the value "ResMed" in the "Made by" field
I should see the value "AirSense 10 AutoSet for Her" in the "Model" field
I should see the value "56221828959" in the "Serial number" field
I see last synced local time

name: View and update personal details in profile
description:
(MCA-164)
(MYAIR-2958)
As a patient
I want to update my profile
so that my Monte Carlo experience is personalised.

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify if the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I enter "CONFIRM" into the "Confirm cell phone" field
I press "Verify"
I should be on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I should see the value "1234567890" in the "Cell phone" field

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-3845) (MCA-3433)
# 1. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to view the phone number in their profile
# 2. If the server indicates the user does not have a validated phone number, the phone number field in the profile shall be hidden
# 3. Given the user has a validated phone number in their profile, the user shall be able to change the phone number
# 4. Given the user has entered an invalid phone number length, the user shall be notified the phone number is invalid
# Note 1: The user must enter a phone number between 1 and 12 digits in length.  The server validates if the phone number is valid or invalid.
# Note: 2: The list of available countries supported is determined by server, see MYAIR-3885 for full list of countries supported by App; server may or may not support SMS for a given country.
# 5. Given the user has entered a valid phone number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code
# 6. Given the user has entered a confirmation code, the App shall send the confirmation code to server
# 7. If the server indicates that the confirmation is invalid, the App shall inform the user the confirmation code is invalid
# 8. If the server indicates that the user has a validated phone number, the user shall be able to delete the phone number in their profile
# Note 3: A validated phone number is one which has been matched with a confirmation code.
# Note: Default phone number for the server mock is 5555555555 (For Automation Purposes only)
# Note: "Change cell phone" screen is same as "Register cell phone" screen (For Automation Purposes only)

steps.name: I am signed in with an existing account

elements.name: Verify when the user has entered a 10 digit number, they shall be asked to enter a confirmation code.

steps.name: the logged in user has a validated phone number for SMS notifications
I open the app on the "About me" screen
I wait for network sync
I tap the "Edit" button
I tap the "Cell phone" field
I should be on the "Register cell phone" screen
I enter "1234567890" into the "Enter cell phone" field
I press "Next"
I should be on the "Confirm cell phone" screen
I should see the "Confirm cell phone instructions" text

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-187)
# Note 1: This card deals with the general use case scenario. Activation errors and retries will be handled in another card.
# Note 2: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# Note 3: This card requires that an api call is made to login service
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2309) (MYAIR-3226)
# 1. After the first successful login of a user, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. date and time that the app was first used
# 1b. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-131)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-347)
# 1. When the user selects the forgot password option, Monte Carlo shall launch the myAir forgot password page.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-219)
# Note 1: This includes getting an authentication token from patient portal
# 1. If the login username and password submitted by the patient are authenticated and the account is active, the patient shall be shown the Dashboard
# 2. If the user entered an email that does not exist in the system, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 3. If the user entered a password that does not match the one associated with the email entered, they shall be notified that the username or password is invalid
# 4. If Monte Carlo cannot establish communications with the authentication server, the user shall be notified of the error
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MYAIR-747)
# 1. On every login, Monte Carlo shall post the following to Patient Portal:
# 1a. push token (if user is logged in and push is enabled)
# 1b. platform (i.e. iOS)
# 1c. date and time that the app was first used
# 1d. account identifier
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-147) (MYAIR-355)
# Note 1: This card deals with the scenario when the user has entered incorrect login details multiple times.
# 1. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be told to wait and try again
# 2. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to enter log in credentials
# 3. When Patient Portal indicates that the users account is frozen, the user shall be able to start the reset password workflow
# Note: Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario because local Patient Portal server accepts all username and password input.

steps.name: I install the app for the first time
I open the app on the "Signin" screen

comments.value: # Note:  Have to perform manual testing with Patient Portal server for this test scenario because local Patient Portal server accepts all username and password input.

elements.name: If the patient entered an email that does not exist in the system they will be notified that the username or password is invalid.

steps.name: I enter "unknow@email.om" into the "Email" field
I enter "Password12" into the "Password" field
Patient Portal will send an invalid password response
I press the "Sign In" button
I see the text "Email or password is invalid"

name: log in, sending data to Patient Portal during login, and forgot password

comments.value: # ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2391) (MYAIR-3111)
# 1.The patient shall be able to view their sleep score and score breakdown for the most recent 30 nights, up to and including the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "Last night".
# 2. The data available to the user shall be displayed in reverse chronological order.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.
# Note 3: "previous nights" includes sleep records with no data or zero usage
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2442) (MYAIR-453)
# 1. Monte Carlo shall not display the sleep score on the dashboard when there is no data for the sleep record.
# 2. The usage, mask leak, events per Hour, and Mask on/off events values and scores will be replaced with a dash.
# Note 1: This dashboard appears when there is no patient data available.
# ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: (MCA-2443) (MYAIR-697)
# 1. When the user navigates to the Dashboard, on launch and by selecting the Dashboard menu item, the newer of "Most Recent Night with data" and "last night" shall be displayed by Monte Carlo.
# Note 1: "Last night" is based on calendar time. So, on the 15th November from 00:00 - 23:59, "Last night" will be the 14th of November (sleep data from 12:00pm 14th Nov - 11:59am 15th November).
# Note 2: The "Most recent Night with Data" is the most recent Sleep Record that has at least one Therapy Session. This includes the current Sleep Record if it contains a complete Therapy Session.

steps.name: all sleep data is cleared
I am signed in with an existing account

comments.value: # note that there are no sleep record yesterday; we can navigate without continuous sleep record sequence.
# note that there are no sleep record today; we cannot navigate without sleep record for the most recent night.

elements.name: You can navigate and see the sleep record with no sleep data has "-" for its scores.  Also when user navigates to Dashboard, the default sleep record displayed is last night (yesterday).

steps.name: the following sleep records exist
I open the app on the "Score" screen
I wait for data sync
I see the score for most recent sleep record
I navigate to 1 day back
I scroll down until I see the "total" field
I see these scores

name: Sleep Record Navigation and display default sleep record
